content:
Diagnosis
	1. Gastric adenocarcinoma (mucinous type)

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Feb 2024 Total gastrectomy with D2 lymphadenectomy

	Chemotherapy
	1. Neo-adjuvant FLOT - 4 cycles completed December 2023 to January 2024
	2. Adjuvant FLOT - 4 cycles completed March to April 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Mild ongoing fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of adjuvant chemotherapy. He has completed all 8 cycles of perioperative FLOT chemotherapy as planned, with the final cycle given on 25/4/24. The treatment course has been relatively uncomplicated with only grade 1-2 toxicities including mild peripheral neuropathy and fatigue. His post-operative recovery has been excellent with good nutritional status maintained throughout adjuvant therapy.

He has adapted well to the post-gastrectomy dietary modifications and his weight has stabilized at 72kg (pre-treatment weight 78kg). Current ECOG performance status is 1. Blood tests today show stable parameters with hemoglobin 118 g/L, WCC 4.8, platelets 156, normal renal and liver function.

On examination today, his surgical wounds are well healed with no concerning features. He has no clinical evidence of disease recurrence.

	Further investigations
	Surveillance CT chest/abdomen/pelvis booked for 3 months

	Medication prescribed
	Vitamin B12 injections to continue every 3 months

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up will be with CT results in 3 months
Surgical follow up arranged with Mr [redacted name] in 6 weeks

	Required GP actions
	Please continue 3-monthly vitamin B12 injections
Monitor iron studies and full blood count every 3 months
Refer back urgently if any new concerning symptoms

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Discussed completion of planned treatment course and transition to surveillance phase. Explained expected recovery timeline and importance of maintaining nutrition. Provided written information about post-treatment surveillance schedule and symptoms that should prompt early review.
